__e: If we stop here for luncheon, then what becomes of our afternoon?
Um... why don't we stop there for today, and I'll see you next week.
Let me tell you, either we leave here together or we make our stand right here together.
Would you mind if I let the flowers at home first?
Say, do you mind if we make a quick stop by my parents' house?
How are we not pausing to have a conversation about this?
Well, I mean, it's not that I don't trust your keen sense of judgment, Captain, but why don't we just stop and ask?

You can either ride home with Chuck, who's probably standing behind me right now making fun of you, or you can go with your mom and dad who love you, and we'll stop by and see aunt Quinn who's all alone.
We'll get something to eat, you'll get the pistol and then we'll all go our separate ways. - Really separate ways.
If you're done just lying there, maybe it's about time that we stop the world from ending!
But it is nothing compared to The bloodbath that's coming if we can't stop the coup.
William, I don't think you understand, the sooner the son of a bitch who leaked this thing stops helping them, the better for us.
We're going to be here a while and he needed a few days to close things up.
No, no, no, it's fine. We won't stay.
Why don't we just call it for tonight, and we can review the rest on our own.
You want us to stop our daughter from growing up because she told you some ridiculous story - about being a boy?
The phone reception was already hinky - before I lost them.
Break up the fight before there's no food left for the party.
